channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition

channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2020 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: Melania Trump aims to erase memories of 2016 in RNC speech
Daniel Dale sets the record straight on the RNC's first night
item.description: CNN's lead fact checker Daniel Dale called the first night of the 2020 Republican National Convention a "parade of dishonesty" and sets the record straight. Click here for more fact checks.

item.title: Trump's coalition is narrowing
item.description: One thing is clear as Republicans convene their national convention this week: This is now President Donald Trump's party. The question is whether it can survive in that form in a country that will grow irreversibly more diverse through the 2020s.

item.title: Lionel Messi wants to leave Barcelona
item.description: Argentine football star Lionel Messi has sent a letter to Barcelona informing the club that he wants to leave the team, a source close to the footballer confirmed to CNN.

item.title: Trump to nominate acting US Homeland Security chief to top role
item.description: President Donald Trump announced in a Tuesday tweet he will officially appoint acting Homeland Security Secretary Chad Wolf to take over the role on a permanent basis.

item.title: Embattled evangelical leader agrees to resign as university's president amid sex scandal
item.description: Jerry Falwell Jr. told CNN Tuesday that he has resigned as president and chancellor of Liberty University, a day after reports that the embattled evangelical leader took part in a sexual relationship with his wife and a former hotel pool attendant.

item.title: Black man in the US apparently went to break up a fight. Now, his family says he's partially paralyzed from an officer's bullets
LeBron James on Wisconsin shooting: Feels like cops leave the house with a motive
item.description: Following the Los Angeles Lakers' game four win against the Portland Trail Blazers, LeBron James spoke at a press conference on the shooting of Jacob Blake and encouraging people to vote for change.

item.title: What Pompeo and Kushner are up to
item.description: Secretary of State Mike Pompeo left for Israel and the Gulf on Sunday not with the two-state solution on his mind; but with a focus on what you might call the 22-state solution: how best to use Arab state relationships with Israel to support President Donald Trump's reelection campaign.

item.title: Fugitive Red Bull heir faces new charges in Thailand
item.description: A court in Bangkok has ordered the arrest of the heir to the Red Bull fortune on fresh charges, adding another twist to a scandal that has turned a spotlight on one of Thailand's wealthiest families.

item.title: 'Rapid intensification' is likely as Hurricane Laura tracks toward US Gulf Coast
item.description: It usually takes several days to even a week for a tropical storm to grow into a powerful hurricane. But if conditions are just right, a major hurricane can develop in just hours.

item.title: Judge denies Ghislaine Maxwell's prison request
item.description: A federal judge has denied Ghislaine Maxwell's request to be moved to the general prison population, saying changes to her confinement are unnecessary at this time.

item.title: Over a dozen dead after stampede at illegal party in Peru
item.description: Thirteen people died in a stampede in Lima, Peru, after police raided an illegal party. Large social gatherings are currently banned in Peru and there is a nationwide 10 p.m. curfew in place due to coronavirus restrictions. Several attendees and victims subsequently tested positive for the virus. CNN's Stefano Pozzebon reports.

item.title: The US surge may be slowing, but officials warn of troubling Covid-19 signs
Fauci: We 'certainly don't know the whole story' about Covid-19
Eradication of polio in Africa is 'great day' WHO director general says
item.description: Polio has been declared eradicated from Africa, the World Health Organization said Tuesday.

item.title: Olympic great Usain Bolt tests positive for Covid-19
item.description: Usain Bolt has tested positive for the coronavirus as Jamaica's Prime Minister says there will no special treatment if anyone has been found to break the rules stemming from a party held for the former sprinter's recent 34th birthday.

item.title: Trump or Biden, which candidate does China want in the White House?
item.description: US President Donald Trump recently claimed that if his Democratic rival Joe Biden wins this November's presidential election, China will "own" the United States and Americans will have to learn to speak Chinese.

item.title: Kim Jong Un's sister has reportedly taken over a key North Korean political post
item.description: Kim Jong Un's sister Kim Yo Jong is effectively running one of the most important political bodies in North Korea, officials in Seoul believe, according to South Korea's defense minister.

item.title: Australian bushfires likely to happen again -- and they could be even worse, inquiry warns
item.description: Australia's record-breaking 2019-20 bushfires were likely made worse by climate change, an inquiry has found, warning that the such devastating wildfires are likely to happen again.

item.title: Twelve killed in India building collapse as rescue operation is suspended overnight
item.description: Rescue workers in western India are hopeful that they can save 19 people still trapped under the rubble of a five-story apartment building that collapsed Monday evening in the state of Maharashtra.

item.title: CNN's Dr. Gupta breaks down the effects of convalescent plasma
item.description: The US Food and Drug Administration issued an emergency use authorization for convalescent plasma to treat Covid-19. CNN's Dr. Sanjay Gupta takes a deeper look at the data and explains why controlled randomized trials are still necessary to fully understand the effectiveness of convalescent plasma.

item.title: New York AG seeks to depose Eric Trump in investigation of Trump's finances
British Museum moves bust of founder who had links to slavery
item.description: The British Museum, home to some of the world's most treasured historic artifacts, has moved the bust of its founder from a display pedestal because of his links to slavery.

item.title: Spain is seeing a surge in Covid-19 cases but fewer deaths
item.description: Spain is launching mass coronavirus testing in a hope to get a snapshot of how the virus is spreading as cases in the country continue to rise. Journalist Atika Shubert reports.

item.title: Tennis players face death threats and online abuse as soon as they step off the court. Tech companies are trying to stop it
item.description: He would dread checking his phone -- and no wonder.

item.title: French city uses muscular approach to enforce Covid-19 rules
item.description: Marseille, a popular tourist city on France's southern coast, has seen a spike in positive coronavirus cases. French authorities have dispatched police to enforce coronavirus regulations. CNN's Melissa Bell reports.

item.title: Sean Connery turns 90. Yes, you read that correctly
item.description: Happy birthday, Sean Connery!

item.title: 'The West Wing' cast will reunite to benefit Michelle Obama's When We All Vote
item.description: Add "The West Wing" to the list of TV reunions in the age of coronavirus, but this time, they're coming together for a specific cause: To benefit Michelle Obama's voter-participation organization When We All Vote by staging an episode for the streaming service HBO Max.

item.title: 'Black people in America are scared,' says LeBron James after Jacob Blake shooting
item.description: LeBron James said his "emotions are all over the place" after the shooting of Jacob Blake.

item.title: Australia kills sale of a dairy business to China as trade tensions rise
Why people are leaving New York city
item.description: CNN's Jason Carroll takes a look at the challenges New York City is facing to mount a comeback following its struggle with coronavirus.

item.title: Fortnite will stay blocked on Apple's app store for now. But Epic did win one important court battle
item.description: Apple will not have to reinstate Fortnite to its app store, at least for now, a federal judge ruled Monday night in a historic legal battle between the iPhone maker and the producer of one of the world's most popular video games.

item.title: University creates student avatars for virtual graduation ceremony
item.description: At universities around the world, graduation ceremonies provide an opportunity to mark an educational achievement with family and friends, but the coronavirus pandemic has robbed students of the chance to do so in the traditional way.

item.title: How the RNC roll call looked a little different than the DNC's
item.description: The 2020 Republican National Convention started with an enthusiastic roll call for President Donald J. Trump.

item.title: Opinion: The RNC looked like a bad parody of 'SNL'
item.description: At times, while watching the pandemic edition of the Republican National Convention, I had to remind myself this wasn't a "Saturday Night Live" parody of the Party of Trump. But it easily could have been.

item.title: Americans can't stop shoving pizza into their faces
item.description: America's pandemic-induced love affair with pizza shows no signs of slowing down.

item.title: Experimental concert could help explain Covid-19 spread at mass events
item.description: Researchers in Leipzig, Germany, staged a 1,500-person experimental indoor concert to better understand how Covid-19 spreads at big events and how to prevent it. CNN's Milena Veselinovic reports.

item.title: Summer camp: Missing a great American tradition
item.description: Rachel Adams-Kaplan knew the detailed schedule of summer camp long before she attended.

item.title: Four-year-old hits a hole-in-one
item.description: Four-year-old Rocco hits his very first hole-in-one on a par 3 golf course in West Virginia.

item.title: Cruise trips are back. This is what they look like now
item.description: Boarding in the Italian port of Genoa for a seven-day Mediterranean cruise on August 16, travel agent Valeria Belardi prepared herself for a voyage like no other.

item.title: Even Cardi B struggled to master this routine to 'WAP'
item.description: How are people injuring themselves with Cardi B's "WAP" song? Jeanne Moos reports on dancing to the ER.

item.title: Mexican woman is fastest climber of world's tallest mountains
item.description: Viridiana Álvarez Chávez was 28 when she first started exercising. She was 36 when she broke the Guinness World Record for the fastest ascent of the top three highest mountains with supplementary oxygen (female) in only one year and 364 days.

item.title: The Black man shot in the back by a cop in front of his kids in Kenosha, Wisconsin, remains in intensive care
item.description: • 'Black people in America are scared,' says LeBron after Blake shooting • Blake's uncle: This is the phone call you don't want to get

item.title: The man who shot video of the shooting describes what happened in the moments before
Jacob Blake apparently went to break up a fight
item.description: Before Jacob Blake became the latest in a long list of police shooting victims, the 29-year-old was a kid growing up in Evanston, Illinois, just outside Chicago, his family told CNN affiliate WLS. He attended high school in Evanston, where he was a member of the wrestling team. He later moved to Kenosha "for a fresh start," his family said.

item.title: Police shoot unarmed Black man
item.description: A 29-year-old Black man is fighting for his life and two White police officers are on administrative leave after a video in Kenosha, Wisconsin, showed officers shoot unarmed Jacob Blake multiple times in the back. CNN's Polo Sandoval reports.

item.title: Man who recorded Jacob Blake's shooting says he's traumatized
item.description: Raysean White had only seen Jacob Blake a couple times since moving to a neighborhood in Kenosha, Wisconsin, in February.

item.title: Jacob Blake's uncle speaks to CNN about shooting
item.description: Justin Blake, the uncle of shooting victim Jacob Blake, has urged protesters to demonstrate peacefully. Jacob Blake was gunned down by police in Kenosha, Wisconsin prompting nationwide anger and protests once again against police brutality.

item.title: How 'good White people' derail racial progress
item.description: It was a scene that seemed like it came from another era.
